Description: Fragment of lip and neck of a narrow-mouthed pottery flask; handle scar on neck. Fine, reddish-yellow (5 YR 6/6) clay with some silver mica. Undecorated.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Saite Pilgrim bottle parallels from Kom Firin (Thomas 2014, nos. C2423, C2539).

For typical flasks of the Late Period, see Spencer 1993, Excavations at El-Ashmunein III: The Town, pl. 72, type K.1; Leclère & Spencer 2014, Tell Dafana Reconsidered, pls 38, 62, no. 22340; Wilson, K. 1982, Cities of the Delta II, Mendes, pl. xvii, 4.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 58, no. E3, pl. 27, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.072)
